etymologies: Old English hwæther, hwether, of Germanic origin; related to German weder ‘neither’

notes.text: On the difference between whether and if, see if

definitions: expressing a doubt or choice between alternatives

examples.text: he seemed undecided whether to go or stay
it is still not clear whether or not he realizes

shortDefinitions: expressing doubt or choice between alternatives

definitions: expressing an inquiry or investigation (often used in indirect questions)

examples.text: I'll see whether she's at home

definitions: indicating that a statement applies whichever of the alternatives mentioned is the case

examples.text: I'm going whether you like it or not

shortDefinitions: indicating that statement applies whichever of alternatives mentioned is case
